This is a longstanding and annoying bug:

   https://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1218961&group_id=73833&atid=539099

Unfortunately, we have no reliable way to reproduce it -- the same URLs that
trigger the error infrequently in large crawls always seem to succeed on
retries, so it clearly requires more than just the content of those URLs.

Any patterns observed or reliable recipe to reproduce this bug would be
very helpful!

> Probably unrelated, but I then get an Out Of Memory error only 48
> minutes into my crawl. How can I tell if the JVM I'm using is 64-bit
> or not? I'm running on JDK 1.5 on Mac OS X Server 10.4.x. I'm a bit
> non-plussed with the rapidity with which I ran out of memory on a 512
> MB heap.
> 
> Here's the info on the OOM:
> 
> Serious error occured trying to process 'CrawlURI http://mikiballet-piano.cocolog-nifty.com/pink/2005/06/post_173f.html LLLL http://mikiballet-piano.cocolog-nifty.com/pink/2005/06/index.html in ExtractorHTML'

>            timestamp  discovered      queued   downloaded       doc/s(avg)  KB/s(avg)   dl-failures   busy-thread   mem-use-KB  heap-size-KB   congestion   max-depth   avg-depth
> 2006-02-21T21:18:52Z      517520      443498        72414     23.35(25.10)   602(594)            15           100       359669        518464       245.15       23694          10
> (in processor ExtractorHTML)
> 
> Pointers?

I don't know if any MacOS VMs are 64bit; I would imagine the info reported
by the VM's -version option would give a good clue.

The status-line, which admittedly can lag the time of the actual OOM, shows only
~350MB used out of the >500MB heap. So this may be a case of a non-heap-related
OOM. (In particular, at times in the past the off-heap memory used by memory-mapped
files have been implicated in non-heap OOMs.) There should be more info in the
heritrix_out.log than the 'Serious Error' alert which may suggest the root cause.

- Gordon @ IA
